headline: Rory McIlroy somehow stays alive at the Players Championship after he is saved by malevolent drama... as Scott Piercy becomes the hapless victim of the unpredictable 17th hole with a quadruple bogey in front of thousands
author: Derek Lawrenson for the Daily Mail
sentences: It's hard to do justice to how much more difficult it was for players in his half of the draw, but the starry cast list of those who headed home early, cursing their misfortune, tells its own story: Collin Morikawa, Jordan Spieth, Brooks Koepka, Xander Schauffele and Brits Matt Fitzpatrick and Lee Westwood to name just a few.

As if all the carnage witnessed on the infamous par three on Saturday was not enough, the thousands who gathered there got to witness another hapless victim when American Scott Piercy stepped on to the tee.
McIlroy had battled the brutal gusts manfully the previous day to play 21 holes in just one over par for a two over total - but it appeared for all the world as if it would be one shot too many.
Rory McIlroy was heading for the unluckiest missed halfway cut of his career at the Players Championship before the island green 17th hole staged one more act of malevolent drama to save him.
said a smiling Tommy Fleetwood, after adding a 73 yesterday to his opening 66 to be two shots off the halfway lead held by Americans Sam Burns and Tom Hoge, both PGA Tour winners this year.
